STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 7, 2023
Jr. Richard D. Doud,
Samaritan Youth Shelter CPA
713 9th Street,
Bay City, MI, 48708
RE: License#: CB090411936
Dear Mr. Doud,:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/31/2023 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
No areas of noncompliance.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Recruitment and program development was discussed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.

Chief Administrator Assessment
There have been no participants active in the program at this time. Discussions at
the time of the onsite visit included plans for recruitment and a review of needs by
the next annual review to maintain a regular license.
Financial Overview
The program has not yet had any active participants. Staff currently involved are
also active in other programs operated by this organization so there is limited
financial support required at this time.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews primarily focused on program development and the utilization of
staff resources who are also involved with other agency programs.
There have not yet been any program participants.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Building is well maintained and there is more than adequate storage for
compliance records storage.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
08/07/2023
